LearningSection.learnCorrectUsage: Learn how to use a menstrual cup correctly with these simple steps.
LearningSection.menstrualCupDescription: A menstrual cup is a small, bell-shaped cup made of medical-grade silicone or rubber that collects blood instead of absorbing it.
LearningSection.step1: Wash your hands thoroughly with soap and water.
LearningSection.step2: Fold the cup — use a 'C-fold' (press sides together to form a C shape) or 'punch-down fold'.
LearningSection.step3: Relax and insert the folded cup into the vagina — it should sit low in the vaginal canal, not as deep as a tampon.
LearningSection.step4: Once inside, let it open fully to create a seal against the vaginal walls (twist slightly to ensure it’s sealed).
LearningSection.step5: You can wear it for 6–12 hours depending on your flow.
LearningSection.step6: To remove, pinch the base to release suction, then gently pull out.
LearningSection.step7: Empty the contents into the toilet, rinse, and reinsert.
LearningSection.cleanStep1: Rinse the cup with cold or lukewarm water every time you empty it.
LearningSection.cleanStep2: If water isn’t available, wipe clean with tissue and rinse later.
LearningSection.afterPeriodStep1: Boil the cup for 5–10 minutes to disinfect it.
LearningSection.afterPeriodStep2: Use a dedicated pot (not one used for food).
LearningSection.afterPeriodStep3: Let it cool and dry completely before storing.
LearningSection.storeStep1: Store in a cotton or breathable pouch (not plastic or airtight).
LearningSection.storeStep2: Keep in a cool, dry place away from sunlight.
LearningSection.storeStep3: Avoid storing it while wet — moisture promotes bacteria growth.

periodPanties.title: Using Period Panties
periodPanties.description: Learn how to use, clean, and store period panties.
periodPanties.useDescription: They look like regular underwear but have absorbent and leak-proof layers.
periodPanties.useStep1: Choose a size that fits well for proper leak protection.
periodPanties.useStep2: Wear directly — no need for pads or tampons (unless your flow is very heavy).
periodPanties.useStep3: Wear for 8–12 hours depending on flow, or change when damp.
periodPanties.useStep4: Keep an extra pair in your pouch to change if needed.
periodPanties.cleanStep1: Rinse immediately in cold water until it runs clear.
periodPanties.cleanStep2: Hand wash or machine wash on gentle using mild detergent.
periodPanties.cleanStep3: Avoid bleach, hot water, or fabric softeners — they damage waterproof layers.
periodPanties.cleanStep4: Air dry in shade — avoid sunlight or dryer heat as it weakens elastic and waterproof fabric.
periodPanties.storeStep1: Store completely dry panties in a clean drawer or breathable bag.
periodPanties.storeStep2: Never store wet panties; moisture causes odor and bacteria.
periodPanties.hygieneStep1: Always wash your hands before and after handling menstrual products.
periodPanties.hygieneStep2: Replace reusable items every 2–5 years depending on use and condition.
periodPanties.hygieneStep3: Regularly check for tears, discoloration, or odor — replace if noticed.
periodPanties.hygieneStep4: If irritation or infection occurs, stop use and consult a gynecologist.

reusablePads.title: Using Reusable Pads
reusablePads.description: Learn the proper way to use, clean, and store reusable menstrual pads.
reusablePads.useDescription: Made of absorbent fabric layers that attach to underwear with wings or snaps.
reusablePads.useStep1: Place the soft absorbent side facing up on your underwear.
reusablePads.useStep2: Wrap wings under and snap or Velcro them together.
reusablePads.useStep3: Change every 4–6 hours, or sooner if it feels wet or heavy.
reusablePads.useStep4: When outside, use a wet bag — fold used pads and store until washed.
reusablePads.cleanStep1: Rinse immediately in cold water to prevent stains.
reusablePads.cleanStep2: Soak in cold water for 30 minutes if needed (add salt or baking soda for odor control).
reusablePads.cleanStep3: Hand or machine wash using mild, fragrance-free soap.
reusablePads.cleanStep4: Avoid hot water, bleach, or fabric softeners — they damage fibers and reduce absorbency.
reusablePads.cleanStep5: Sun-dry completely — sunlight naturally disinfects and removes odor.
reusablePads.storeStep1: Store completely dry pads in a clean cloth bag or drawer.
reusablePads.storeStep2: Keep in a cool, dry place (avoid damp bathrooms).
reusablePads.storeStep3: Wash and sun-dry once every few weeks even if unused to keep fresh.

menstrualCup.title: Using a Menstrual Cup
menstrualCup.description: Learn how to use a menstrual cup correctly with these simple steps.
menstrualCup.step1Description: Wash your hands with soap and water.
menstrualCup.step2Description: Fold the menstrual cup for insertion.
menstrualCup.step3Description: Gently insert the cup into the vagina.
